page.title: 02Farms in Belsay Parish
page.content: This block contains the homesteads for 10 farms, although some of their fields overlap the block boundary. The average farm size is 300 acres. Approx 1600 acres are rented from landowners and approx 1400 acres are owner/occupied. Some of the land belonging to landowners is let out annually by auction for the period May to November for summer grazing. Present value of good farmland is from Â£1500 to Â£2500 per acre. Rented land under an agricultural tenancy costs Â£40 to Â£60 per acre per annum. Grass parks for summer grazing make up to Â£100 per acre at auction. The land is classed as heavy loam and is suitable for growing barley, wheat, oilseed rape and root crops such as turnips and potatoes.The present trend is for farms to be sold when vacated.
